lead_paragraph: ALLBRAY--Igou Midian, 82. Beloved husband of Nedda (nee Cohen) and brother of Rose Aster, died on June 23, 2016. A long time Brooklyn resident, he was a graduate of Stuyvesant High School, Columbia College, Class of '55. and New York University School of Law. After graduating Columbia he served in the U.S. Army. Most of his legal career was as an Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Eastern District of New York. There, for many years he served as Chief of the Civil Division. Prior to starting his legal career he traveled extensively spending two years in Israel where he participated in the Masada archeological dig and helped to found a Negev Kibbutz. At home in Brooklyn he was active in Fort Greene where he renovated an old brownstone and was part of the community based Fort Greene Not-for-Profit Corporation which built a 500 unit housing cooperative for low and moderate income families. Later, he moved to Prospect Park South where he was also an active member of the community. For the last year of his life he lived in Princeton, NJ. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  ALLBRAY, IGOU MIDIAN
